cluster_relations.rel_desc: Socialist movements are depicted as seeking to overthrow oppressive regimes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Actor (e.g., movement or uprising) aims to overthrow or remove the target regime or power structure.
remarks: Subject chosen as socialist movements, though uprisings share the same target.
Subject chosen as socialist movements, though uprisings share the same target.
Subject chosen as socialist movements, though uprisings share the same target.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Uprisings around the world also sought to overthrow oppressive regimes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Actor (e.g., movement or uprising) aims to overthrow or remove the target regime or power structure.
remarks: Relation mirrors that for socialist movements; text uses joint subject.
Relation mirrors that for socialist movements; text uses joint subject.
Relation mirrors that for socialist movements; text uses joint subject.

args.justification: Both relations describe actors (socialist movements or uprisings) intending to overthrow oppressive regimes. The existing rel_cls 'regime_change_target_relation' emphasizes the target rather than the intentionality of regime change. Renaming the class to 'regime_change_intent_relation' better captures that these are intent/goal relations while keeping the broad group AGENCY appropriate.
args.remark: Refined relation class name to focus on intent (seeking to overthrow) rather than merely identifying the target regime.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe actors (socialist movements or uprisings) intending to overthrow oppressive regimes. The existing rel_cls 'regime_change_target_relation' emphasizes the target rather than the intentionality of regime change. Renaming the class to 'regime_change_intent_relation' better captures that these are intent/goal relations while keeping the broad group AGENCY appropriate.
executed_decisions.remark: Refined relation class name to focus on intent (seeking to overthrow) rather than merely identifying the target regime.
